result.execSummary:
The defendant Leonard A Boardman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If reconfined or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Pursuant to Wis. Stat 973.05(4)(b), restitution to be paid from all prison funds, not to exceed 25% of gross.  The remainder due to be paid on a monthly basis while on extended supervision.

Outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If reconfined or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete an alcohol assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant is to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Defendant subject to random testing by his agent.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete a drug assessment, and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Defendant subject to random testing by his agent.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.

Defendant shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, or by any other means with the victims, or his co-defendants Donna Deloski, Jesse Dehaven, Adam Greenwald and Stephanie Treu.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with extended supervision conditions.

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Attorney Fredrickson.   Defendant plead to Theft, Count 2 in 15CF166.  Count 1, 16CF45.  Clark Co. 16CM51.  to be read in.  Joint recommendation for  8 years. 16CF45.  4 years incarceration and  4 years extended supervision.  4 years on 13CF182 concurrent, 2 years incarceration and 2 years extended supervision.  In 15CF166,  2 years incarceration and 18 months extended supervision.  Concurrent to 16CF45.  Rest.  CC.  Eligible for SAP.  Not CIP.  Victim notification complied with.  All other criminal and traffic cases and counts dismissed, but read in for sentencing purposes.    Court recited the charges and possible penalties on the counts he plead to.  Defendant understood.  Felony warnings given.  Defendant understood.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant.  Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the pleas.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently entered his pleas and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the pleas.  Found guilty of Theft, contrary to 943.20(1)(a) in 15CF166 and Burglary, contrary to 943.10(1m)(a) in 16CF45.  Clark Co. 16CM51.  Jackson Co.  15CM88, 15CT24,15CF80, 15CF181 and traffic citations  dismissed, but read in.  

State recommended: 8 years total in 16CF45.  4 years incarceration and 4 years extended supervision. 15CF181:  Koehler $500.00 rest.  15CF166: $3450.00.  8,000 approx.  other.  Eligible for SAP.  Concurrent with 13CF182.  15CF166:  3 1/2 years total.   2 years incarceration and 18 months extended supervision.   Concurrent with 16CF45.  25% of prison funds to go toward restitution.  Defense is in agreement with the recommendation.  

Court ordered:  8 years total in 16CF45.  4 years incarceration and 4 years extended supervision. Concurrent with 13CF182.  In 15CF166:  3 1/2 years total.   2 years incarceration and 18 months extended supervision.   Concurrent with 16CF45, 13CF182.  

25% of prison funds to go toward restitution. 15CF181:  Koehler $500.00 rest.  15CF166: $3450.00.  8,000 approx.  other.  Eligible for SAP.  

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  AODA, and recommended treatment.  Random testing.    Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  Restitution.  Pay monthly through extended supervision  15CF166.  D.B.  3450.00.  15CF80 B. $500.00.  Am Family 7583.85.  15CF181 K. $500.00.  Obtain and maintain employment upon release.  25% of prison funds ordered applied to rest.  No contact with the victims. or co-defendants, Donna D.  Jesse Dehaven.  Adam Greenwald.  Stephanie Treu.  Eligible for SAP.  Not CIP.  

Credit 13CF182.  202 days.  16CF45, 80 days credit.  15CF166,  7 days credit.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 26, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Information filed with the court.   Waive reading of the information.  NGP entered by the court.  Set for plea hearing with JA.  Not on a Monday.  45 minutes.

Court questioned the defendant on his understanding of the waiver of preliminary hearing.  Defendant stated that he understood.  Court found that the defendant knowingly, intelligently, freely and voluntarily waived his right to a preliminary hearing.

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared by video from the Jackson County Jail.  Attorney Paul Fredrickson appeared specially, in court.  Receipt of the complaint acknowledged.  Cash bond set.  AIA set for 3/21/16 at 9 am.

Covers Case No. 15CF80, 15CF181, 15CF166, 15CM88, 15CT24 and 16CF45.   Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on the highways until properly reinstated in the State of Wisconsin.  Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals and/or businesses:   co- defendant:  A.G. and DD,  The Arrowhead Lodge, its property or employees, Sunrise Security Storage, or D.B; the victim in 15CF166, or G.K.; the victim in 15CF181.
